clinical_study.brief_title: Age Differences in Influenza and Herpes Zoster Vaccine Responses (INFLUENZA-SHINGRIX)
clinical_study.official_title: Exploratory Study Into Age-related Immunological Differences Related to Immunogenicity in Influenza Vaccination and Herpes Zoster Vaccination

brief_summary.textblock:
Vaccines are used to prevent infectious diseases worldwide. Unfortunately, many vaccines, like the flu vaccine, are less effective in older adults.
This single-centre open label partially randomised, partially placebo-controlled trial evaluates the differences in immune response between young and older adults after vaccination with a quadrivalent inactivated influenza vaccine and an adjuvanted herpes zoster vaccination.
Exploring the underlying mechanisms between the differences in immunogenicity can provide important information for future vaccine development.

detailed_description.textblock:
Rationale: Vaccination of the older adults is often advised as they are a high-risk population; however, vaccine efficacy generally decreases with age. This is mainly due to a decrease in adaptive immune responses known as immunosenescence, which is a factor influencing the response to influenza vaccination. On the other hand, there are vaccines that show high efficacy (more than 95%) in older adults, one of the most effective being the AS01 adjuvanted herpes zoster vaccine, Shingrix. The differential immune pathways associated with vaccine responsiveness as well as the immune mechanisms by which adjuvants overcome immunosenescence remain poorly understood. Targeting key immune pathways could be a way to improve vaccine efficacy in older adults.
Objective: To explore immunological features between young and older adults after administration of an adjuvanted herpes zoster (Shingrix) or influenza unadjuvanted (Fluarix) vaccine that could explain differences in vaccine immunogenicity.
Study design: A single centre open label, randomised, and partially placebo-controlled trial Study population: Approximately 140 healthy adults, 80 of which are between 18-35 years old, the other 60 are 65+ years old.
Intervention: Two groups of young and elderly volunteers receive recombinant zoster vaccine (Shingrix), while two other groups will receive a quadrivalent influenza vaccine (Fluarix). Two groups of young volunteers will receive a placebo.
Main study parameter: To identify immune senescence-related differences contributing to vaccine immunogenicity

primary_outcome.measure: Changes in cytokine productions of PBMCs upon incubation with viral, bacterial, and fungal antigens
primary_outcome.description: IL-6, TNF, IL-1b, IFNg cytokine concentrations will be measured.

primary_outcome.description: IL-6, TNF, IL-1b, IFNg cytokine concentrations will be measured.

secondary_outcome.description: Ratio of adaptive immune cells (T and B cells) and their subtypes will be measured by FACS.

secondary_outcome.description: B and T cell receptors will be sequenced.

secondary_outcome.description: B and T cell receptors will be sequenced.

secondary_outcome.measure: Changes in circulating protein concentrations
secondary_outcome.time_frame: 2 months after influenza vaccination
secondary_outcome.description: Concentrations of circulating inflammatory proteins, including TNF, IL-6, IL-8, CCL3, CCL4, CXCL9, CXCL10, CXCL11, will be measured by Olink.

secondary_outcome.measure: Changes in circulating protein concentrations
secondary_outcome.time_frame: 2 months after the first dose of herpes zoster vaccination
secondary_outcome.description: Concentrations of circulating inflammatory proteins, including TNF, IL-6, IL-8, CCL3, CCL4, CXCL9, CXCL10, CXCL11, will be measured by Olink.

secondary_outcome.measure: Influenza vaccine-specific antibodies in the serum
secondary_outcome.time_frame: 2 months after influenza vaccination
secondary_outcome.description: HAI titers will be measured.

secondary_outcome.measure: Shingles vaccine-specific antibody production in the serum
secondary_outcome.time_frame: 2 months after the first herpes zoster vaccination
secondary_outcome.description: Anti-gE titers will be measured.

secondary_outcome.measure: Shingles vaccine-specific antibody production in serum
secondary_outcome.time_frame: 2 months after the second herpes zoster vaccination
secondary_outcome.description: Anti-gE titers will be measured.

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of participants reporting local reactions
secondary_outcome.time_frame: 7 days after influenza and herpes zoster vaccination
secondary_outcome.description: Pain at the injection site, redness, and swelling

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of participants reporting systemic events
secondary_outcome.time_frame: 7 days after influenza and herpes zoster vaccination
secondary_outcome.description: Fever, fatigue, headache, chills, vomiting, diarrhea

secondary_outcome.measure: Changes in epigenetic markers in PBMCs
secondary_outcome.time_frame: 2 months after influenza vaccination
secondary_outcome.description: ATAC-sequencing will be performed to measure post transcriptional modifications (methylation, acetylation, etc) on histones.

secondary_outcome.measure: Changes in epigenetic markers in PBMCs
secondary_outcome.time_frame: 6 months after influenza vaccination
secondary_outcome.description: ATAC-sequencing will be performed to measure post transcriptional modifications (methylation, acetylation, etc) on histones.

secondary_outcome.measure: Changes in epigenetic markers in PBMCs
secondary_outcome.time_frame: 2 months after the first herpes zoster vaccination
secondary_outcome.description: ATAC-sequencing will be performed to measure post transcriptional modifications (methylation, acetylation, etc) on histones.

secondary_outcome.measure: Changes in epigenetic markers in PBMCs
secondary_outcome.time_frame: 2 months after the second herpes zoster vaccination
secondary_outcome.description: ATAC-sequencing will be performed to measure post transcriptional modifications (methylation, acetylation, etc) on histones.

secondary_outcome.measure: Changes in epigenetic markers in PBMCs
secondary_outcome.time_frame: 6 months after the second herpes zoster vaccination
secondary_outcome.description: ATAC-sequencing will be performed to measure post transcriptional modifications (methylation, acetylation, etc) on histones.

secondary_outcome.measure: C-reactive protein in the serum
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline (before vaccination)
secondary_outcome.description: Soluble C-reactive protein (CRP) concentrations will be measured.

arm_group.description: Young adults between 18 and 35 years old will receive the herpes zoster vaccine (Shingrix). 60 days later, they will receive a booster dose.
Adults older than 65 years of age will receive the herpes zoster vaccine (Shingrix). 60 days later, they will receive a booster dose.
Young adults between 18 and 35 years old will receive the influenza vaccine (Fluarix Tetra).
Adults older than 65 years of age will receive the influenza vaccine (Fluarix Tetra).

arm_group.arm_group_label: 5: Young adults herpes zoster vaccination related placebo
arm_group.description: Young adults between 18 and 35 years old will receive the placebo injection (0.9% NaCl). 60 days later, they will receive another placebo.

arm_group.arm_group_label: 6: Young adults influenza vaccination related placebo
arm_group.description: Young adults between 18 and 35 years old will receive the placebo injection (0.9% NaCl).

intervention.description: Shingrix is an ASO1-adjuvanted herpes zoster vaccination used to prevent shingles and its associated complications in at-risk populations

intervention.intervention_name: Influenza Vaccine (Fluarix Tetra Northern Hemisphere 2021, GSK)
intervention.description: Fluarix Tetra is a quadrivalent inactivated influenza vaccine

intervention.arm_group_label: 5: Young adults herpes zoster vaccination related placebo
6: Young adults influenza vaccination related placebo

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Healthy
- Age between 18-35 years old OR age ≥65 years old
- Written informed consent
Exclusion Criteria:
- Known allergy to (components of) the influenza or herpes zoster vaccine
- Immunocompromised subjects
- Previous herpes zoster vaccination in the last year
- Receipt of any vaccination 1 month prior to the start of the study or plans to receive any other vaccination until the last study visit
- Chronic use of systemic drugs other than oral contraceptives
- Use of NSAIDS less than 4 weeks prior to the start of the study
- Acute or active illness within two weeks prior to the start of the study
- Pregnant, breastfeeding or planning to become pregnant during the study period
